thread.title: New Kids On The Block songwriter Tommy Page dead aged 46 in suspected suicide
thread.title_full: New Kids On The Block songwriter Tommy Page dead aged 46 in suspected suicide

author: Lucy Buckland
title: New Kids On The Block songwriter Tommy Page dead aged 46 in suspected suicide
text:
New Kids On The Block songwriter Tommy Page dead aged 46 in suspected suicide Tributes have been paid to the talented singer, songwriter and music producer Share Tributes have been paid to the 'true entertainer' Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
New Kids On The Block have paid tribute to songwriter Tommy Page who has died aged 46. 
The Iâ€™ll Be Your Everything singer died after taking his own life, Billboard reports. 
He is survived by his husband Charlie and their three children. 
Page, who once toured with New Kids On The Block and co-wrote his number one hit I'll Be Your Everything with band members Jordan Knight and Danny Wood, is thought to have been depressed in the days leading up to his death. NKOTB paid tribute to the songwriter (Photo: Twitter) 
NKOTB Donnie Wahlberg paid tribute to the singer: The reminders of how precious life is, are all around us. Yet, we so often take the present moment for granted. Be #Thankful for today. RIPTommyPage." 
After his career on stage Tommy later became a music executive but went on to record nine studio albums. 
He worked with Michael Buble, Alanis Morissette, Josh Groban, David Foster and Green Day Warner Bros./Reprise Records and was responsible for shaping many of today's superstars. Tommy on stage in 2014 (Photo: Getty Images) 
In 2011 he joined Billboard as associate publisher and promoted to publisher the following year. 
'We are all morning the loss of our friend and colleague Tommy Page,' Billboard Entertainment Group President John Amato said in a statement. 
'He was a magnetic soul and a true entertainer. Our thoughts are with his family.' Like us on Facebook
